FuncDef: The display multicast ipv6 rpf-info command displays Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) routing information of an IPv6 source or an IPv6 source group, including currently used topology name and information about all routes.
CLIs: display multicast ipv6 rpf-info <ipv6-source-address> [ <ipv6-group-address> ] [ rpt | spt ] [ verbose ]
display multicast ipv6 { vpn-instance <instance-name> | all-instance } rpf-info <ipv6-source-address> [ <ipv6-group-address> ] [ rpt | spt ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a multicast source. If this parameter is specified, RPF routing information of this multicast source is displayed.
The address is in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the IPv6 address of a multicast group. If this parameter is specified, RPF routing information of this source group is displayed.
The address ranges from FF00::0 to FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF.

Display the information of rendezvous point tree (RPT).
-

Display the information of shortest path tree (SPT).
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: RPF interface: GigabitEthernet1/0/1, RPF neighbor: FE80:4000::7
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An RPF route is an optimal route with the destination address being source-address and selected from the unicast routing table and static multicast routing table.
To display the RPF routing information of a specified multicast source, such as the information about the multicast source, status of the RPF interface, RPF neighbor, and routing information, run the display multicast ipv6 rpf-info command.
